Class Rational

java.lang.Object
  Rational

public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object

A class of rational numbers with integer numerator and denominator.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Eric Steegmans

Constructor Summary
Rational()
          Initialize this new rational number with numerator 0 and arbitrary denominator.

          Initialize this new rational number with numerator 1 and given denominator.

          Initialize this new rational number with given numerator and denominator.

isValidDenominator

public static boolean isValidDenominator(long denominator)
Check whether the given denominator is a valid denominator for any rational number.

Parameters:
denominator - The denominator to check.
Returns:
True if the given denominator is positive; false otherwise. | result == denominator > 0

isIdenticalTo

public boolean isIdenticalTo(Rational other)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Return a boolean reflecting whether this rational number is identical to the given rational number.

Parameters:
other - The rational number to compare with.
Returns:
True if the numerator and denominator of this rational number are equal to the numerator, respectively the denominator of the other rational number; false otherwise. | result == | (getNumerator() == other.getNumerator()) && | (getDenominator() == other.getDenominator())
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [must] The other rational number is not effective. | other == null

times

public Rational times(long factor)
               throws TimesOverflowException
Return a rational number obtained by multiplying this rational number with the given integer number.

Parameters:
factor - The integer number to multiply with.
Returns:
The resulting rational number is effective. | result != null
Throws:
TimesOverflowException - [must] The product of the numerator of this rational number in normalized form with the given factor divided by the greatest common divisor of the absolute value of that factor and the denominator of this rational number in normalized form is outside the range of the type long. | let | reducedFactor = factor / ExtMath.gcd | (Math.abs(factor),this.normalize().getDenominator()) | in | ! ExtMath.areMulipliable | (this.normalize().getNumerator(),reducedFactor)

add

public Rational add(Rational other)
             throws OverflowException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Return a new rational number obtained by adding the given rational number to this rational number. Only a simple version is worked out here.

Parameters:
other - The righthand side of the addition.
Returns:
The resulting rational number is effective. | result != null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [must] The other rational number is not effective. | other == null
OverflowException - [must] The numerator of the one rational number cannot be multiplied with the denominator of the other rational number. | (! ExtMath.areMultipliable | (getNumerator(),other.getDenominator()) ) || | (! ExtMath.areMultipliable | (getDenominator(),other.getNumerator()) )
OverflowException - [must] The cross-products of the numberator of the one rational rational number with the denominator of the other rational number cannot be added. | ! ExtMath.areAddable | (getNumerator() * other.getDenominator(), | getDenominator() * other.getNumerator())
OverflowException - [must] The denominators of both rational numbers cannot be multiplied. | ! ExtMath.areMultipliable | (getDenominator(),other.getDenominator())

getCommonFactor

public long getCommonFactor()
Return the common factor of the numerator and the denominator of this rational number.

Returns:
The greatest common divisor of the absolute value of the numerator and the denominator of this rational number. | result == | ExtMath.gcd(Math.abs(getNumerator()),getDenominator())

normalize

public Rational normalize()
Return a new rational number in normalized form with the same value as this rational number.

Returns:
The resulting rational number is effective. | result != null

isNormalized

public boolean isNormalized()
Check whether this rational number is normalized.

Returns:
True if the common factor of this rational number is 1; false otherwise. | result == (getCommonFactor() == 1)
